intro: Hoya marginata, commonly known as the wax plant or sweetheart plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and clusters of waxy, star-shaped flowers. The plant is a trailing or climbing species that can grow up to several meters in length. Its leaves are usually dark green with a waxy coating, and it produces fragrant flowers in shades of white, pink, and red. Hoya marginata is popular as a houseplant due to its low maintenance and attractive appearance.
